title: Proof The US Is An Oligarchy, Not A Democracy

comments.text:
It's hard to take these Young Turk idiots serious when they start off with 
crap like "We are not a democracy anymore", since we never were a 
Democracy, this Country is supposed to be a Republic. Read the Pledge of 
allegiance. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pledge_of_Allegiance﻿
comments.author: FullSpectrum Survivalist

comments.author: Adolph Oliver Bush

comments.text:
There certainly is no easy answers to this problem, but I have one 
suggestion that could be implemented fairly easily that WOULD definitely 
change the democracy part of our Representative Government Republic.  
Voting should be done 100% through the mail (absentee ballot) AND a $500 
fine should be imposed for not voting.  Currently if just a third of the 
eligible voters that don't vote got together they could elect any one they 
choose.  Break the back of the corporate controlled "Two Party System" and 
at least the voters will be truly representative and will have to be 
'heard' by anyone trying to get into, or stay in Power.  4 or 5 parties 
would force coalition type government which truly represents the will of 
the people.  Some people do have to be forced to do the right thing and 
$500 would cause the 50% or more people that don't bother to vote.  I'm a 
fairly conservative Libertarian that tends to vote for the 'lesser of two 
evils' but I DO Vote for the last 40 years...﻿

comments.text:
America is not and has never has been a Democracy; electing leaders was 
considered an Oligarchic procedure in Ancient Greece. Good connections and 
an ability to make good speeches gives you an inherent advantage. If 
America was meant to be a Democracy then membership of the House of 
Representatives would be chosen by lot! ﻿
comments.author: Saxo Ungrammaticus

comments.text:
+Saxo Ungrammaticus Sorry, my mistake there were a few of officials who 
were elected besides the generals but the vast majority of magistrates were 
chosen by lot.
comments.author: Saxo Ungrammaticus

comments.text:
Look at Ancient Athens- most of the officials and the council of 500 was 
chosen by lot; anyone (male citizen) could turn up and vote on policy in 
the Assembly. The only positions that were elected were the 10 generals 
(who were too important to be just anyone off the street). The best form of 
constitution is one combining elements of democracy with elements of 
oligarchy The main problem with our modern societies is that they are 
simply run in the interest of greed, selfishness and short-term gains. The 
masses are quite capable of all 3 of these.
comments.author: Saxo Ungrammaticus

comments.author: Jakob Presley

comments.text:
America was founded as a constitutional republic, established to protect 
the rights of the individual.

We then drifted (at least in spirit and for various reasons) into a 
democracy in which individual rights were subordinated to the 'greater 
good.'

With individual responsibility abandoned and the whims of pure democracy 
creating instability, everyone looks to 'the leaders' to solve their 
problems, thus the citizens now embrace oligarchy.

The next logical step is tyranny.

This cycle was outlined by Machiavelli in 'The Prince' 500 years ago. It 
still applies today.﻿

comments.text:
To all the newer people showing up and reading all the comments, there are 
people here who are all hung up on whether the USA is a Republic or a 
Democracy. A Republic is a Representative (not a direct) Democracy, so 
right away we are dealing with a distraction and a false dichotomy. Let's 
focus on what we CAN do. We can vote (yeah yeah, think it doesn't matter? 
Watch what happens this year in 2015) You can either give up (and if you 
give up, then shut the f*ck up) or you can fight. You fight by voting and 
by getting involved with wolf-pac and with represent.us and with mayday.us 
Inform yourselves and vote, take action! If you care ... do something! 
anything! (non violent, peaceful means, legal means). But seriously if 
you've given up or just want to snipe shoot ... then fine, shut the F up 
then. Why bother yourselves with something you don't give a shit about?﻿

New amendments: Feel free to add 
28.  Corporations are not people.
29.  Money is not speech.
30 The US may never again  have a central bank

33 Lobbying is illegal

includes other business ventures. 
34a All of congress must place the contents of their bank accounts up for 
public scrutiny on the internet
35 All presidential elections must have at least 4 cannidates
35a All presidential candidates are limited to a set number of finances for 
campaigns. This money will be taken from taxes, and the public will have 
full access to view  the campaign bank accounts. 
36. The electorial college is abolished. 
37. Large free trade agreements such as WTO and NAFTA are forbidden 
38. If one outsources they are required by law to pay the going wage for 
that position in it's  US equivalent. Thus, a man in Thailand for example 
would make the exactly the same amount as a worker in america. ( Gets rid 
of outsourcing without getting rid of it)
39. The internet is free and private. The collection of data on citizens is 
strictly forbidden 
40.Executive order is abolished
41. The government must never spend more than it's GDP
42. Parties are abolished. Politicians must stand on their own. 
43. The government must never be in touch with mainstream media
44. All children must take a civics class from 1st grade until the end of 
 high school. These classes will also include critical thinking of politics 
and to teach younger individuals how to stay informed of their government.
45. Interest rates must NEVER be controlled
46. Government subsidies to companies are forbidden 
47.  Abolish the dept. of homeland security and any organization like it. 
48. War on small groups not affiliated with any country must be voted on by 
the american public. 
49. Giving arms to groups to fight another is illegal unless approved by 
60% or more of the american public
50. Paper voting ballads are to be encouraged as the primary way of voting 
over electronic means. 
51. Abolish the TSA
52. Abolish the Dept. of Education. Education will be handled by local and 
state governments. 
53.  Healthcare for the truly needy will be free. There will be criteria to 
meet. 
53b. Hospitals will have a cap on how much they can charge someone. 
54. Entangling alliances are forbidden
55. US bases are to only be situated in a set number of countries. Every 
other base will be abolished. 
56. Overturn NDAA and the Patriot act.  free to add﻿

[dumb] people always respond to the stimulus of patriotism, which is used 
in every instance where the oligarchs have an interest, whether it'd be to 
protect Wall Street, start a war for oil or accept the police state. The
